newsitem.title: USA: Computer Language sees revenue growth.
newsitem.headline: Computer Language sees revenue growth.

text.p: Computer Language Research Inc said on Thursday that it expected revenue growth to hit roughly 10 to 12 percent in 1997.
In addition, the company anticipated operating margins for the year, excluding amortization and acquisition related charges, to be in the 12 to 14 percent range.

Computer Language, which provides tax automation systems, posted second quarter results below last year's levels, reporting a net loss of $0.23 per share compared with a loss of $0.08 for the year-ago period.
"However, year-to-date results are well ahead of last year and in line with our expectations," said company president Stephen Winn.
